title: Can you please rate if my vocals are okay to pass a K-pop audition? - Quora

response.answer_text: Your singing voice is good but when it comes to way you sing , it changes. During singing you have to be relaxed but you were singing at high tones, it also can have a bad effect on your voice. Me also tried to sing the whole song at high notes and I lost my singing voice after it, although I got it back but it took 2-3 months to get back . Try relaxing your body and face as much as you can while singing. Don't work up with your vocal cords too much it harms . Warm up at least 1 hour everyday . Don't sing on high notes if not needed . To find your actual singing voice. 1 . Relax your whole body . 2. Warm up your vocal cords. 3. Take a deep breath ( through nose . Through mouth only while singing) 4. Then do the lowest note you can. 5. Increase notes one by one . 6. Stop at note you are most comfortable with. ( Best with piano or any key instrument) I hope this helped you. 👍

your voice is very sweet but the song is out of your vocal range like totally out of it and you couldn't get the pitches right and your vocal was also very very unstable and you have breathing problems also …sorry to say but you are not even 1% ready for audition….try doing vocal exercises more rather than singing for now

Your voice is pretty good but its very unstable and stability plays very prominent role in music so…….but practise regularly and choose songs wisely acc to your singing range it seems that this song doent matches with your range.
This all depends on judges whether they like it or not they will judge you by your vocal strength, rythem , the song you have choose it fit you or not etc. So sorry i cant judge you .
Your voice would be 7/10 rating. I think you should improve on your high notes. And you’re going a little off-tune. Other than that you’re doing quite well.
I can't judge your vocals but I think you should mainly focus on your high notes. I hope it helps ☺️!!!
